description: Real-world negotiation dilemmas from forums and communities

dilemmas.title: Salary expectation too low
dilemmas.text: Candidate anchored too low early; needs to revise expectation without losing credibility.
dilemmas.situation: User stated lower salary than desired during initial screening
recommended_actions: Re-anchor using updated market range supported by 2–3 sources
Tie request to recent measurable impact (two concrete achievements)
Offer a decision window (5–7 business days) to reduce uncertainty
mitigation: Address anchoring bias explicitly: explain new information and why range changed
Avoid apologetic tone; use neutral, value-first phrasing

phased_solution.immediate: Frame as new information: 'After deeper research, the market range is...'

cultural_variations.UK: Use softening language: 'I wonder if we might revisit...'

dilemmas.example_reply: After taking a closer look at recent market data and aligning it with my recent impact, the standard range for this role is £74k–£82k. Given my contributions, I’m targeting £78k.

dilemmas.title: Counterparty dismisses data
dilemmas.text: Counterparty challenges or mocks the data source; shift to multiple sources and value framing.
dilemmas.situation: Hiring manager laughs when citing Glassdoor data
rebuttal_strategies: Cite multiple sources: 'Glassdoor, Levels.fyi, and industry reports show...'
Pivot to value: 'My requested salary reflects the unique value I bring in...'
recommended_actions: Triangulate with at least three sources before restating the range
Calmly ask which sources they consider credible and use those as reference
Translate market range into ROI/impact terms specific to the role
mitigation: Avoid defending a single source; focus on convergence across sources
Keep tone steady; do not mirror dismissiveness
dilemmas.example_reply: Totally fair—one source can vary. When I combine Levels.fyi, Glassdoor’s role-specific cuts, and the latest industry report, they converge around £76k–£82k. Given my recent outcomes, targeting £78k is consistent with that.
